examples: it's too dark to see much

adjective.description: (of a color or object) not reflecting much light; approaching black in shade.
(of a period of time or situation) characterized by tragedy, unhappiness, or unpleasantness.
examples: the dark days of the war

adjective.description: Denoting a velarized form of the sound of the letter l as it sounds at the end of a word or before another consonant (as in full or bulk in most accents of English).

noun.description: The absence of light in a place.
examples: Carolyn was sitting in the dark

noun.description: A dark color or shade, especially in a painting.

phrases: My theme was that the darkest hour is just before the dawn, and though it does seem to be the darkest hour, we have to have some Resurrection hope and keep learning from our partners and walking forwards.
They say that the darkest hour is just before the dawn and in this case it is true.
She understood that the harshest suffering precedes the redemption, that the darkest hour is just before the dawn.
So take heart, the darkest hour is just before the dawn.
Remember that the darkest hour is just before the dawn.
origin: Old English deorc, of Germanic origin, probably distantly related to German tarnen conceal.
